52.88650\xc2\xb0\n         </span>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row" style="max-width:11em;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Albedo" title="Albedo">\n          Albedo\n         <th style="padding-left:1.0em">\n            <a href="/wiki/Celsius" title="Celsius">\n             Celsius\n            </a>\n           </th>\n           <td>\n            \xe2\x88\x92143\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0C\n            <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cold_12-0">\n             <a href="#cite_note-cold-12">\n              [10]\n             </a>\n            </sup>\n \xe2\x88\x92226\xc2\xa0\xc2\xb0F\n            <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cold_12-1">\n             <a href="#cite_note-cold-12">\n              [10]\n             </a>\n            </sup>\n   </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row" style="max-width:11em;">\n         <div style="padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Apparent_magnitude" title="Apparent <th scope="row" style="max-width:11em;">\n         <div style="padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Angular_diameter" title="Angular diameter">\n           Angular diameter\n          </a>\n         </div>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         3.5\xe2\x80\x9325.1\xe2\x80\xb3\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nssdc_9-2">\n          <a href="#cite_note-nssdc-9">\n           [7]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;background-color:#a0ffa0">\n         Atmosphere\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nssdc_9-4">\n          <a href="#cite_note-nssdc-9">\n           [7]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-barlow08_14-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-barlow08-14">\n           [12]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row" style="max-width:11em;">\n         <div style="padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">\n          Surface\n          <a href="/wiki/Atmospheric_pressure" title="Atmospheric pressure">\n           pressure\n          </a>\n         </div>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         0.636 (0.4\xe2\x80\x930.87)\n         <a href="/wiki/Pascal_(unit)" title="Pascal (unit)">\n          kPa\n         </a>\n         <br/>\n         0.00628\xc2\xa0atm\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row" style="max-width:11em;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Atmospheric_chemistry#Atmospheric_composition" title="Atmospheric chemistry">\n          Composition by volume\n         </a>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <div class="plainlist">\n          <ul>\n           <li>\n            95.97%\n            <a href="/wiki/Carbon_dioxide" title="Carbon dioxide">\n             carbon dioxide\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li>\n            1.93%\n            <a href="/wiki/Argon" title="Argon">\n             argon\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li>\n            1.89%\n            <a href="/wiki/Nitrogen" title="Nitrogen">\n             nitrogen\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li>\n            0.146%\n            <a href="/wiki/Oxygen" title="Oxygen">\n             oxygen\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li>\n            0.0557%\n            <a href="/wiki/Carbon_monoxide" title="Carbon monoxide">\n             carbon monoxide\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td colspan="2" style="text-align:center">\n         <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <p>\n       <b>\n        Mars\n       </b>\n       is the fourth\n       <a href="/wiki/Planet" title="Planet">\n        planet\n       </a>\n       from the\n       <a href="/wiki/Sun" title="Sun">\n        Sun\n       </a>\n       and the second-smallest planet in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Solar_System" title="Solar System">\n        Solar System\n       </a>\n       after\n       <a href="/wiki/Mercury_(planet)" title="Mercury (planet)">\n        Mercury\n       </a>\n       . In English, Mars carries a name of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Mars_(mythology)" title="Mars (mythology)">\n        Roman god of war\n       </a>\n       , and is often referred to as the "\n       <b>\n        Red Planet\n       </b>\n       "\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Zubrin1997_15-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Zubrin1997-15">\n         [13]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rees2012_16-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Rees2012-16">\n         [14]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       because the reddish\n       <a href="/wiki/Iron(III)_oxide" title="Iron(III) oxide">\n        iron oxide\n       </a>\n       prevalent on its surface gives it a\n       <a href="/wiki/Mars_surface_color" title="Mars surface color">\n        reddish appearance\n       </a>\n       that is distinctive among the astronomical bodies visible to the naked eye.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nasa_hematite_17-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-nasa_hematite-17">\n         [15]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Mars is a\n       <a href="/wiki/Terrestrial_planet" title="Terrestrial planet">\n        terrestrial planet\n       </a>\n       with a thin\n       <a href="/wiki/Atmosphere" title="Atmosphere">\n        atmosphere\n       </a>\n       , having surface features reminiscent both of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Impact_crater" title="Impact crater">\n        impact craters\n       </a>\n       of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Moon" title="Moon">\n        Moon\n       </a>\n       and the valleys, deserts, and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Polar_ice_caps" title="Polar ice caps">\n        polar ice caps\n       </a>\n       of\n       <a href="/wiki/Earth" title="Earth">\n        Earth\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rotational_period" title="Rotational period">\n        rotational period\n       </a>\n       and seasonal cycles of Mars are likewise similar to those of Earth, as is the tilt that produces the seasons. Mars is the site of\n       <a href="/wiki/Olympus_Mons" title="Olympus Mons">\n        Olympus Mons\n       </a>\n       , the largest\n       <a href="/wiki/Volcano" title="Volcano">\n        volcano\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_tallest_mountains_in_the_Solar_System" title="List of tallest mountains in the Solar System">\n        second-highest known mountain in the Solar System\n       </a>\n       , and of\n       <a href="/wiki/Valles_Marineris" title="Valles Marineris">\n        Valles Marineris\n       </a>\n       , one of the largest canyons in the Solar System. The smooth\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Borealis_basin" title="Borealis basin">\n        Borealis basin\n       </a>\n       in the northern hemisphere covers 40% of the planet and may be a giant impact feature.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-northcratersn_18-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-northcratersn-18">\n         [16]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-northcraterguard_19-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-northcraterguard-19">\n         [17]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Mars has two\n       <a href="/wiki/Moons_of_Mars" title="Moons of Mars">\n        moons\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Phobos_(moon)" title="Phobos (moon)">\n        Phobos\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Deimos_(moon)" title="Deimos (moon)">\n        Deimos\n       </a>\n       , which are small and irregularly shaped. These may be captured\n       <a href="/wiki/Asteroid" title="Asteroid">\n        asteroids\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20">\n        <a href="#cite_note-20">\n         [18]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-adler_21-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-adler-21">\n         [19]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       similar to\n       <a href="/wiki/5261_Eureka" title="5261 Eureka">\n        5261 Eureka\n       </a>\n       , a\n       <a href="/wiki/Mars_trojan" title="Mars trojan">\n        Mars trojan\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       There are ongoing investigations assessing the past\n       <a href="/wiki/Planetary_habitability" title="Planetary habitability">\n        habitability\n       </a>\n       potential of Mars, as well as\n       <a href="/wiki/Life_on_Mars" title="Life on Mars">\n        the possibility of extant life\n       </a>\n       . Future astrobiology missions are planned, including the\n       <a href="/wiki/Mars_2020" title="Mars 2020">\n        Mars 2020\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ExoMars_rover" title="ExoMars rover">\n        ExoMars\n       </a>\n       rovers.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-curiosity_search_for_life_22-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-curiosity_search_for_life-22">\n         [20]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MER_Search_for_Life_23-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MER_Search_for_Life-23">\n         [21]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ExoMars.27s_search_for_life_24-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-ExoMars.27s_search_for_life-24">\n         [22]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Mars_2020_search_for_life_25-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Mars_2020_search_for_life-25">\n         [23]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Liquid\n       <a href="/wiki/Water_on_Mars" title="Water on Mars">\n        water\n       </a>\n       cannot exist on the surface of Mars due to low atmospheric pressure, which is less than 1% of the Earth\'s,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nasa.gov_26-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-nasa.gov-26">\n         [24]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       except at the lowest elevations for short periods.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-h_27-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-h-27">\n         [25]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-jgr110_28-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-jgr110-28">\n         [26]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The two polar ice caps appear to be made largely of water.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-kostama_29-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-kostama-29">\n         [27]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-sci299_30-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-sci299-30">\n         [28]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The volume of water ice in the south polar ice cap, if melted, would be sufficient to cover the entire planetary surface to a depth of 11 meters (36\xc2\xa0ft).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nasa070315_31-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-nasa070315-31">\n         [29]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In November 2016,\n       <a href="/wiki/NASA" title="NASA">\n        NASA\n       </a>\n       reported finding a large amount of\n       <a href="/wiki/Water_on_Mars" title="Water on Mars">\n        underground ice\n       </a>\n       in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Utopia_Planitia" title="Utopia Planitia">\n        Utopia Planitia\n       </a>\n       region of Mars. The volume of water detected has been estimated to be equivalent to the volume of water in\n       <a href="/wiki/Lake_Superior" title="Lake Superior">\n        Lake Superior\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-32">\n        <a href="#cite_note-32">\n         [30]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33">\n        <a href="#cite_note-33">\n         [31]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NASA-20161122_34-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-NASA-20161122-34">\n         [32]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Mars can easily be seen from Earth with the naked eye, as can its reddish coloring. Its\n       <a href="/wiki/Apparent_magnitude" title="Apparent magnitude">\n        apparent magnitude\n       </a>\n       reaches \xe2\x88\x922.91,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nssdc_9-5">\n        <a href="#cite_note-nssdc-9">\n         [7]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       which is surpassed only by\n       <a href="/wiki/Jupiter" title="Jupiter">\n        Jupiter\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Venus" title="Venus">\n        Venus\n       </a>\n       , the Moon, and the Sun. Optical ground-based telescopes are typically limited to resolving features about 300 kilometers (190\xc2\xa0mi) across when Earth and Mars are closest because of Earth\'s atmosphere.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-usra_35-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-usra-35">\n         [33]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <div class="toclimit-3">\n       <div class="toc" id="toc">\n        <div class="toctitle">\n         <h2>\n          Contents\n         </h2>\n        </div>\n        <ul>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1">\n          <a href="#Physical_characteristics">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            1\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Physical characteristics\n           </span>\n          </a>\n          <ul>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-2">\n            <a href="#Internal_structure">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              1.1\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Internal structure\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-3">\n            <a href="#Surface_geology">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              1.2\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Surface geology\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-4">\n            <a href="#Soil">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              1.3\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Soil\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-5">\n            <a href="#Hydrology">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              1.4\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Hydrology\n             </span>\n            </a>\n            <ul>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-6">\n              <a href="#Polar_caps">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                1.4.1\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Polar caps\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n            </ul>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-7">\n            <a href="#Geography_and_naming_of_surface_features">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              1.5\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Geography and naming of surface features\n             </span>\n            </a>\n            <ul>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-8">\n              <a href="#Map_of_quadrangles">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                1.5.1\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Map of quadrangles\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-9">\n              <a href="#Impact_topography">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                1.5.2\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Impact topography\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-10">\n              <a href="#Volcanoes">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                1.5.3\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Volcanoes\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-11">\n              <a href="#Tectonic_sites">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                1.5.4\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Tectonic sites\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-12">\n              <a href="#Holes">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                1.5.5\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Holes\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n            </ul>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-13">\n            <a href="#Atmosphere">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              1.6\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Atmosphere\n             </span>\n            </a>\n            <ul>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-14">\n              <a href="#Aurora">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                1.6.1\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Aurora\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n            </ul>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-15">\n            <a href="#Climate">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              1.7\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Climate\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-16">\n          <a href="#Orbit_and_rotation">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            2\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Orbit and rotation\n           </span>\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-17">\n          <a href="#Habitability_and_search_for_life">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            3\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Habitability and search for life\n           </span>\n          </a>\n          <ul>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-18">\n            <a href="#Search_for_life">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              3.1\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Search for life\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-19">\n          <a href="#Moons">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            4\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Moons\n           </span>\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-20">\n          <a href="#Exploration">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            5\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Exploration\n           </span>\n          </a>\n          <ul>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-21">\n            <a href="#Future">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              5.1\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Future\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-22">\n          <a href="#Astronomy_on_Mars">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            6\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Astronomy on Mars\n           </span>\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-23">\n          <a href="#Viewing">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            7\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Viewing\n           </span>\n          </a>\n          <ul>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-24">\n            <a href="#Closest_approaches">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              7.1\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Closest approaches\n             </span>\n            </a>\n            <ul>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-25">\n              <a href="#Relative">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                7.1.1\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Relative\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n             <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-26">\n              <a href="#Absolute.2C_around_the_present_time">\n               <span class="tocnumber">\n                7.1.2\n               </span>\n               <span class="toctext">\n                Absolute, around the present time\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </li>\n            </ul>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-27">\n          <a href="#Historical_observations">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            8\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Historical observations\n           </span>\n          </a>\n          <ul>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-28">\n            <a href="#Ancient_and_medieval_observations">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              8.1\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Ancient and medieval observations\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-29">\n            <a href="#Martian_.22canals.22">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              8.2\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Martian "canals"\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-30">\n            <a href="#Spacecraft_visitation">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              8.3\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Spacecraft visitation\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-31">\n          <a href="#In_culture">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            9\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            In culture\n           </span>\n          </a>\n          <ul>\n           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-32">\n            <a href="#Intelligent_.22Martians.22">\n             <span class="tocnumber">\n              9.1\n             </span>\n             <span class="toctext">\n              Intelligent "Martians"\n             </span>\n            </a>\n           </li>\n          </ul>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-33">\n          <a href="#See_also">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            10\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            See also\n           </span>\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-34">\n          <a href="#Notes">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            11\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            Notes\n           </span>\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-35">\n          <a href="#References">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            12\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            References\n           </span>\n          </a>\n         </li>\n         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-36">\n          <a href="#External_links">\n           <span class="tocnumber">\n            13\n           </span>\n           <span class="toctext">\n            External links\n           </span>\n          </a>\n         </li>\n        </ul>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Physical_characteristics">\n        Physical characteristics\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <p>\n       Mars is approximately half the diameter of Earth with a surface area only slightly less than the total area of Earth\'s dry land.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nssdc_9-6">\n        <a href="#cite_note-nssdc-9">\n         [7]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Mars is less dense than Earth, having about 15% of Earth\'s volume and 11% of Earth\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Mass" title="Mass">\n        mass\n       </a>\n       , resulting in about 38% of Earth\'s surface gravity. The red-orange appearance of the Martian surface is caused by\n       <a href="/wiki/Iron(III)_oxide" title="Iron(III) oxide">\n        iron(III) oxide\n       </a>\n       , or rust.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-rust_36-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-rust-36">\n         [34]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       It can look like butterscotch;\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ismars_37-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-ismars-37">\n         [35]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       other common surface colors include golden, brown, tan, and greenish, depending on the\n       <a href="/wiki/Mineral" title="Mineral">\n        minerals\n       </a>\n       present.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ismars_37-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-ismars-37">\n         [35]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <div class="thumb tmulti tnone center">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:586px;max-width:586px">\n        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:176px;max-width:176px">\n         <div class="thumbimage">\n          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Mars,_Earth_size_comparison.jpg">\n           <img alt="" data-file-height="1562" data-file-width="2399" height="113" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Mars%2C_Earth_size_comparison.jpg/174px-Mars%2C_Earth_size_comparison.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Mars%2C_Earth_size_comparison.jpg/261px-Mars%2C_Earth_size_comparison.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Mars%2C_Earth_size_comparison.jpg/348px-Mars%2C_Earth_size_comparison.jpg 2x" width="174"/>\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">\n          Comparison:\n          <a href="/wiki/Earth" title="Earth">\n           Earth\n          </a>\n          and Mars\n         </div>\n        </div>\n        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:202px;max-width:202px">\n         <div class="thumbimage">\n          <div class="PopUpMediaTransform" id="mwe_player_0"
